text: South Africa’s rand inched lower with investors pricing in domestic risks ahead of the annual budget where the financial crisis at state power utility Eskom is set to be addressed. On Wednesday the rand was at R14.04 to the dollar, R18.34 to the pound and R15.93 to the euro.

text: South Africa’s rand inched lower with investors pricing in domestic risks ahead of the annual budget where the financial crisis at state power utility Eskom is set to be addressed. On Wednesday the rand was at R14.04 to the dollar, R18.34 to the pound and R15.93 to the euro.
text_html: South Africa’s rand inched lower with investors pricing in domestic risks ahead of the annual budget where the financial crisis at state power utility Eskom is set to be addressed. On Wednesday the rand was at R14.04 to the dollar, R18.34 to the pound and R15.93 to the euro.

text: South Africa had a Budget surplus because of surprisingly high tax revenues. Not having a big deficit proved useful when the global financial crisis hit: SA could borrow more than if it already was in big deficits.
